issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

projectCategory.description: Titanium and related SDKs used in application development
projectCategory.name: Client

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description: We are using the "iOS document types" concept to handle specific file extensions in our app, using plist-configs and the {{Ti.App.iOS}} event {{handleurl}}. This works *great*, but it does not work so great when the app was not booted before. A quick peek identified the issue to be because the core did not finish booting before attempting to fire the event, which is because someone (actually, me back then :-) forgot to wrap the notification into a boot-check block. A fix is coming.
fields.summary: iOS: URL-handling does not work if the app is booted from cold-start
